titleStmt.title: The true effigies of the German giant, now to be seen at the Swan near Charing-Cross, whose stature is nine foot and a half in height, and the span of his hand a cubit compleat. He goes from place to place with his wife, who is but of an ordinary stature, and takes money for the show of her husband.

The true effigies of the German giant, now to be seen at the Swan near Charing-Cross, whose stature is nine foot and a half in height, and the span of his hand a cubit compleat. He goes from place to place with his wife, who is but of an ordinary stature, and takes money for the show of her husband.

p.name: London : Printed for Matthew Collins at the Three Black Birds in Cannon-street,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
